title: Ethical Practice in Online Language Education: Applied Philosophy-Based Microlearning and Text Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational ethics concepts, online learning experience, foundational language skills (reading, writing, speaking, listening), introductory text analysis
context.additional_context: In a smartphone-based language learning environment, this course analyzes ethical dilemmas and cultivates practical judgment through text interpretation and expression strategies (e.g., contextual vocabulary selection, grammatical accuracy).

learning_goals: Identify three or more ethical conflict cases (e.g., plagiarism, copyright infringement, linguistic discrimination) that may arise in online language learning environments and explain their structural context through text analysis

Apply Aristotleâ€™s concept of 'phronesis (practical wisdom)' to make ethical decisions in everyday language education contexts and exercise expressive judgment (e.g., reflecting cultural sensitivity)

Present five ethical standards for establishing learner-instructor relationships in digital language learning environments (e.g., fairness in feedback, cultural sensitivity, transparency in communication, appropriateness of vocabulary selection, consideration of reading levels)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
